benchmark_details.name: COMPARISON QA
benchmark_details.overview: COMPARISON QA benchmark contains 283K abstract questions, each instantiated by a pair of high-frequency and low-frequency entities, enabling controllable comparison to study the role of knowledge frequency in LLM performance.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMs' factual knowledge and measure their robustness regarding high-frequency and low-frequency knowledge.

data.source: Generated through an automatic pipeline based on raw knowledge bases, specifically DBpedia.
data.annotation: Validated through expert verification with majority voting.

methods: Two-round method utilizing correctness and uncertainty
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions against ground truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and lower uncertainty indicate better factual knowledge understanding.
methodology.validation: Expert verification of question quality showed 95.5% correctness.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset will be released under a CC license, the DBpedia dataset used is shared under the CC BY-SA license.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Expert verifications obtained IRB approval and were voluntary.
